Ilja Preuss wrote:
> J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
>  > javayang@... wrote:
>  >
>  >> Is it possible to write a test method that accepts arguments?  How do
>  >> I change add the hooks to the framework so these methods get call?
>  >
>  > No need to "add hooks". Here is a simple example.
>  >
>  > public void testIndexOf() {
>  >      assertEquals(-1, "hello".indexOf("d"));
>  > }
> 
> I think the OP was speaking about something like
> 
> public void testIndexOf(int i) {
>    ...
> }
> 
> I am not clear what that would be usefull for, though - perhaps a
> parametrized test, again?

If the OP was talking about the Paramterized Test Case, then yes, I 
agree with your other post on the subject.

Thanks.
